text: Ivan Babaryka (; born 11 November 1982) is a Ukrainian long distance runner who specialises in the marathon. ==Career== He began his career as a track athlete and became the Ukrainian indoor champion over 3000 metres in 2006.Babaryka Ivan. IAAF. Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He won the 2007 Moscow International Peace Marathon, running a time of 2:20:34 in severe weather conditions.Kurdyumova, Yelena & Porada, Sergey (9 September 2007). Severe weather hampers times, as Ukrainians win at Moscow marathon. IAAF. Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He finished in second place with a time of 2:14:55 at the 2008 Mainz Marathon, behind compatriot Andriy Naumov.Wenig, Jorg (4 May 2008). Yator and Kraus battle the heat to take the Düsseldorf Marathon – German news round-up. IAAF. Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He returned to Moscow in September and defended his marathon title with a time of 2:20:11.September 2008 AIMS Results. Association of International Marathons and Distance Races. Retrieved on 12 April 2010. The following year, he was again runner up at the Mainz Marathon, this time to Sammy Kipkoech Tum, recording a season's best time of 2:15:36.Mainz bleibt Mainz – viermal die Eins . Lauf Report (10 May 2009). Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He finished fifth at the Albstädter Citylauf with a time of 30:06, but he was the fastest European runner outside of the all- Kenyan top four.3rd Volksbank-Ebingen-Citylauf in Albstadt report + results, 11.10.2009. Marathon Scene (13 October 2009). Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He started 2010 with a win in the Championship of Ukraine of the Ministry of Internal Affairs 5K cross country race.Ivan Babaryka has won the Championship of Ukraine of the Ministry of Internal Affairs on cross-country. MKTB Kyiv(2 April 2010). Retrieved on 12 April 2010. He was a surprise winner of the Pyongyang Marathon in April that year, knocking nearly a minute of his previous marathon best with 2:13:56 to take victory over more favoured opposition.Jalava, Mirko (12 April 2010). Surprise victory by Babaryka in Pyongyang – Mangyongdae Prize Marathon report. IAAF.
